question:
Which of the following form the Consolidated Fund of India:
  1. All revenues received by Government
  2. All loans raised by Government
  3. All receipts from recoveries of loans granted by Government
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: All revenues received by Government, loans raised by it, and also its receipts from recoveries of loans granted by it, form the Consolidated Fund. All expenditure of Government is incurred from the Consolidated Fund and no amount can be withdrawn from the Fund without authorization from Parliament.
